Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class Conversions

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions
public class Conversions extends Object
Utility class providing mathematical conversions for probability, rates, and odds transformations. This class implements conversions commonly used in epidemiological and statistical modelling.

Key Mathematical Relationships: \[ \newcommand{\prob}{p} \newcommand{\rate}{\lambda} \newcommand{\period}{T} \newcommand{\odds}{o} \]

  • Exponential Distribution: Probability from rate: \[ \prob = 1 - e^{-\rate} \]
  • Logistic Transformation: Logit function: \[ \text{logit}(\prob) = \ln\left(\frac{\prob}{1-\prob}\right) \]
  • Odds Ratio Scaling: Adjusted probability: \[ \text{logit}(\prob_{\text{adj}}) = \text{logit}(\prob) + \ln(OR) \]

Domain Constraints:

  • Probabilities must be in range [0, 1]
  • Rates must be non-negative
  • Periods must be positive
  • Odds ratios must be positive finite values

All methods handle edge cases appropriately, returning appropriate limits for boundary inputs.

See Also:
  • Math.exp(double)
  • Math.log(double)

      public Conversions()

  • Method Details

    • expit

      public static double expit(double logOdds)
      Inverse logistic transformation (expit function). Converts log-odds to probability. \[ \text{expit}(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}} \]
      Parameters:
      logOdds - log-odds value
      Returns:
      equivalent probability

    • halfLifeFromProbability

      public static double halfLifeFromProbability(double p)
      Calculates half-life from probability. Inverse of probabilityFromHalfLife(double). \[ T_{1/2} = \frac{\ln(0.5)}{\ln(1-\prob)} \]
      Parameters:
      p - daily probability
      Returns:
      half-life

    • logit

      public static double logit(double p)
      Logistic transformation (logit function). Converts probability to log-odds. \[ \text{logit}(p) = \ln\left(\frac{p}{1-p}\right) \]
      Parameters:
      p - probability in range (0, 1)
      Returns:
      log-odds

    • multiplyLogit

      public static double multiplyLogit(double logOdds1, double logOdds2)
      Multiplies two probabilities on the log-odds scale. Equivalent to independent probability multiplication. \[ \text{logit}(p_1 \cdot p_2) = \text{logit}(p_1) + \text{logit}(p_2) \]
      Parameters:
      logOdds1 - first log-odds
      logOdds2 - second log-odds
      Returns:
      combined log-odds

    • oddsFromProbability

      public static double oddsFromProbability(double probability)
      Converts probability to odds. Inverse of probabilityFromOdds(double). \[ \odds = \frac{p}{1-p} \]
      Parameters:
      probability - probability value
      Returns:
      equivalent odds

    • oddsRatio

      public static double oddsRatio(double p1, double p2)
      Calculates the odds ratio between two probabilities. \[ OR = \frac{\odds_1}{\odds_2} = \frac{p_1/(1-p_1)}{p_2/(1-p_2)} \]
      Parameters:
      p1 - first probability
      p2 - second probability
      Returns:
      odds ratio

    • periodFromProbability

      public static double periodFromProbability(double p)
      Converts a probability to the equivalent average time period. Inverse of probabilityFromPeriod(double). \[ \period = -\frac{1}{\ln(1-\prob)} \]
      Parameters:
      p - probability in range [0, 1)
      Returns:
      average time period
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if probability is 1 (infinite period)

    • probabilityFromHalfLife

      public static double probabilityFromHalfLife(double halfLife)
      Calculates probability from half-life using the median (50th percentile). \[ \prob = 1 - \exp\left(-\frac{\ln(2)}{T_{1/2}}\right) \]
      Parameters:
      halfLife - median time to event
      Returns:
      daily probability

    • probabilityFromOdds

      public static double probabilityFromOdds(double odds)
      Converts odds to probability. \[ p = \frac{\odds}{1 + \odds} \]
      Parameters:
      odds - odds value
      Returns:
      equivalent probability

    • probabilityFromPeriod

      public static double probabilityFromPeriod(double period)
      Converts an average time period to the per-unit-time probability of transition under an exponential distribution model. \[ \prob = 1 - e^{-1/\period} \]
      Parameters:
      period - average time to event (must be positive)
      Returns:
      probability of event occurring in one time unit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if period is negative

    • probabilityFromQuantile

      public static double probabilityFromQuantile(double period, double quantile)
      Calculates the probability from a specified quantile and period. \[ \prob = 1 - \exp\left(-\frac{\ln(1-q)}{\period}\right) \]
      Parameters:
      period - time period
      quantile - probability threshold
      Returns:
      daily probability

    • probabilityFromRate

      public static double probabilityFromRate(double rate)
      Converts a rate parameter to the per-unit-time probability of event occurrence under an exponential distribution assumption. \[ \prob = 1 - e^{-\rate} \] Commonly used to convert transmission rates to daily probabilities.
      Parameters:
      rate - event rate (lambda parameter of exponential distribution)
      Returns:
      probability of event in one time unit

    • rateFromProbability

      public static double rateFromProbability(double p)
      Converts a probability to the equivalent rate parameter. Inverse of probabilityFromRate(double). \[ \rate = -\ln(1-\prob) \]
      Parameters:
      p - probability in range [0, 1)
      Returns:
      equivalent rate parameter
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if probability is 1 (infinite rate)

    • rateFromQuantile

      public static double rateFromQuantile(double period, double quantile)
      Calculates the rate parameter given a specific quantile of the exponential distribution. Useful when specifying durations using percentiles rather than means. \[ \rate = -\frac{\ln(1-q)}{\period} \]
      Parameters:
      period - time period for the quantile
      quantile - probability threshold (e.g., 0.95 for 95th percentile)
      Returns:
      rate parameter

    • rateRatio

      public static double rateRatio(double p1, double p2)
      Calculates rate ratio between two probabilities. Simple ratio on probability scale. \[ RR = \frac{p_1}{p_2} \]
      Parameters:
      p1 - first probability
      p2 - second probability
      Returns:
      rate ratio

    • scaleProbabilityByOR

      public static double scaleProbabilityByOR(double p, double oddsRatio)
      Scales a probability by an odds ratio using logistic transformation. \[ p_{\text{adj}} = \text{expit}(\text{logit}(p) + \ln(OR)) \]
      Parameters:
      p - original probability
      oddsRatio - multiplicative factor
      Returns:
      adjusted probability

    • scaleProbabilityByRR

      public static double scaleProbabilityByRR(double p, double rateRatio)
      Scales a probability by a rate ratio (simple multiplication). \[ p_{\text{adj}} = p \cdot RR \] Note: Result may exceed 1.0 if RR > 1/p.
      Parameters:
      p - original probability
      rateRatio - multiplicative factor
      Returns:
      scaled probability

    • scaleRateByOR

      public static double scaleRateByOR(double rate, double oddsRatio)
      Scales a rate by an odds ratio using logistic transformation. Applies the odds ratio on the log-odds scale.
      Parameters:
      rate - original rate parameter
      oddsRatio - multiplicative factor on odds scale
      Returns:
      scaled rate

    • waneLogOdds

      public static double waneLogOdds(double logOdds, double period, double maxPeriod)
      Applies exponential waning to log-odds over time. Models diminishing effect with hyperbolic decay. \[ \text{logOdds}_{\text{waned}} = \text{logOdds} \cdot \frac{x}{x + t} \]
      Parameters:
      logOdds - original log-odds
      period - current time period
      maxPeriod - maximum period for full waning
      Returns:
      waned log-odds
